ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: worked on my thesis! the mentors do a great job making sure you do little bits of manageable work and procrastinate less than you otherwise would
I've been developing my thesis in this class and have valued having deadlines to work towards and people to bounce ideas off of/seek advice from.
I learned how to better organize my time while writing a major research paper. I also learned how to write the key components of a research paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: every week felt really doable but also productive! it's difficult to do though if you don't have a clear idea of what you want to write about at the beginning though so start thinking about it early

some assignments and most weekly meetings seemed largely pointless and felt like busy work, which was unnecessary since we were already tasked with writing a thesis; others were helpful steps in preparing to write the thesis but these were few and far between
This course provides a valuable structure to completing the thesis.

The assignments helped make the students work on their thesis, but for many weeks the assignments felt like busy work that did not require high-quality work. Creating assignments that require more thought from the students could help them engage better.

Strengths: provides structure to the thesis process, and the small group format creates a sense of community among students and professor.
Weaknesses: 4pm deadlines were very inconvenient as they were kind of in the middle of my day, while I was just getting out of another class (other people in my group also expressed frustration with this timing, so it wasn't just me); would much rather have had a 11:59pm deadline. Some of the assignments also felt like they overlapped/asked us to turn in very similar products. For me, it would have been most helpful to have to turn in a certain number of pages each week.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! park is a great mentor
Yes if you're in EVST. Otherwise it doesn't really make sense.
Yes; it's helpful to have a structured thesis
